title: Sample Card, ca. 1835
medium:
Medium: cotton on paper
Technique: Fabrics are roller-printed oncotton plain weave.
inscribed: At the top of the page is a pasted down paper print on an eagle on a rock with a ship in the background and the text, "American Print Works". Handwritten in ink on the outside cover, "Sample card of Prints in Store of Nathaniel White, South Deerfield, N.H., about the year 1835."
dimensions:
Height:167cm (65in.). Width: 34cm (13 1/4in.).
Pattern: Although there are twenty-two fabrics samples, there are only four         different patterns for the patterns have been printed in different colors  so that each pattern occurs five or six times.
description: Twenty-two examples of printed cotton pasted onto a long folding piece of heavy paper. The paper folds twelve times to create a horizontal rectangle. Although there are twenty-two samples, there are only four different patterns for the patterns have been printed in different colors.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sample Card, ca. 1835.
ca. 1835. Medium: cotton on paper
Technique: Fabrics are roller-printed oncotton plain weave.. Bequest of Elinor Merrell. 1995-50-6.
